quest.name: Escape from Castrum Centri
journal: Cid awaits confirmation of your readiness to undertake the rescue mission.

After much painstaking preparation, the time has finally come to infiltrate Castrum Centri and rescue your fellow Scions. Don your imperial pot helm and short robe, and proceed to the rendezvous point east of the stronghold.

You have succeeded in entering the castrum undetected. Next, you must gather information on where your comrades are being held. Approach three imperial soldiers and greet each with a disarming /imperialsalute.

Based on what you have learned, Minfilia and the others are being held within the storage tower. Accessing this tower requires a special identification key, which you must somehow obtain from the imperial centurion. Approach the forbidding fellow and win his good opinion with a perfectly executed /imperialsalute.
Through deft use of the magic word, you succeed in convincing the centurion to loan you his identification key. Biggs will know what to do with it.
Using the identification key, you have gained access to the sector in which the storage tower stands. Enter the tower via the steel gate, and set your friends free.

Though the rescue mission was a success, the shocking revelation that Thancred has been possessed by Lahabrea has cast a dark pall over the Scions. Painful though this blow may be, you have no choice but to take it on the chin and forge on for the sake of Eorzea.
You have safely arrived in Ul'dah. Speak with Minfilia to learn her mind.
None can say how the Alliance leaders may respond to the threat posed by the Ultima Weapon, but Minfilia is certain of one thing: so long as it exists, Eorzea shall never know peace.
objectives: Speak with Cid while disguised as an imperial soldier.
Give Biggs the imperial identification key.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: How go your preparations, Forename? We leave as soon as you're ready.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Glaumunt! You came!

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Aye─thought I'd give you all a roarin' send-off. 'Tis the least I can do for the fine men an' women what're about to make my lifelong wish come true.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Well, we'll do our best! Hmmm... It occurs to me, for all the help you've afforded us, we know little and less about you. What did the Empire do to earn your ire? ...Ah, but I fear I've put curiosity before consideration. I quite understand if you'd rather not relive those memories.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: No, no, I don't mind, really. Truth be told, a part o' me was itchin' to tell you my tale. Mind you, 'tis hardly novel─I ain't the first to suffer at imperial hands.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Like most folk, I used to have a mother. She was a sweet, carin' woman with a smile never far from her face. There was a sister too. Pretty little thing, she was─gentle as a lamb, but tough as nails. We were poor folk livin' simple lives, but we knew happiness just the same.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: An' then the imperials came an' took it all away. When Ala Mhigo fell, they put my family in a camp. Bein' a lad, I was made to do hard labor, while my mother an' sister were forced to do far worse... They hid their sufferin' from me as best they could, but I knew, an' the thought of it drove me mad. We had to escape. An' so I hatched a plan to get us out o' the city.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: We were pickin' our way around a gorge not far outside the walls when they caught up with us... An' rather than allow 'emselves to be taken again, my mother an' sister leaped over the edge before my very eyes. Heartbroken as I was, I didn't put up a fight when the imperials clapped me in chains an' dragged me back.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: 'Twas some years after that I escaped again, an' that time, I got away. I swore then that I'd get revenge on the Empire, an' became an adventurer so as to hone my skills an' earn the coin I needed. But nigh on two decades've since gone by, an' what've I achieved? Bugger all, that's what.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Not like you lot. You ain't been here ten minutes, an' you've already done more'n I managed in ten bloody years.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: You give us too much credit, Glaumunt. We seek only to rescue our friends.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Well, what's more important than that? An' anyroad, after you've got your friends back, you're plannin' on goin' after the Empire, an' don't pretend you ain't.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: I've helped a few folk take on the imperials over the years, an' every time I have, it's helped stave off my appetite for revenge. But summat tells me I won't be goin' hungry for a while what with everythin' you've got planned.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And you are sure that will satisfy you? If you wish to strike back at the Empire with your own hand, you need only say the word. We would be glad to have you with us.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Temptin' though your offer is, I'm afeared I must decline.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: I swore I'd get revenge on the Empire, 'tis true, but I've long since realized that the front lines are no place for a man like me.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: Aye, there's some as would call me craven, but I prefer to think o' myself as a realist. My talents lie in schemin', ye see, not swordplay. Helpin' folk like you is how I can make the most difference.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: ...But that's quite enough storytellin' for one day. Best not keep your friends waitin' any longer. I'll be prayin' for your safety an' success. May Rhalgr give you strength!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Wherever the Empire goes, misery invariably follows in its wake.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: For the sake of all who call Eorzea home, we must put an end to Gaius's ambitions.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But first, we have friends to rescue.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Biggs, Wedge, and I will lie in wait east of Castrum Centri, just outside the stronghold's patrol perimeter.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text:
Join us when you're ready.
Oh, and don't forget to wear your disguise, or this will be the shortest rescue mission in history.

dialogue.name: SLAFBORN
dialogue.text: Want to go in? It hardly needs saying, but try not to be seen.

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: Proceed to Cid's workshop?

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: EVENTAREA
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: There you are. A patrol should be heading back to the castrum any moment now, so for gods' sakes, don your disguise.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: If you've misplaced your disguise, hurry back to Revenant's Toll. Glaumunt told me that he'd acquired some additional helms and robes for just such an eventuality. Whatever you do, though, do it swiftly. We need you here and in imperial uniform if this plan is going to work.

dialogue.name: GLAUMUNT
dialogue.text: ...Eh? Lost your imperial disguise? You daft sod! 'Tis lucky I thought to acquire some spares... In case you've forgotten, these ain't exactly easy to get hold of. Be more careful with 'em this time.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This is it, Forename. Time to rescue our comrades.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Infiltrate Castrum Centri?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Forgive me for saying so, but you look rather finecut quite a dashing figure in imperial black and crimson! Definitely your colors! Ahhh, but now is not the time for jests.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Let's review the infiltration plan. Castrum Centri lies just beyond.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: A short while ago, an imperial patrol left to do its rounds.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Alphinaud and I will create a diversion out here and keep them occupied for as long as we are able. Meanwhile, the three of you will enter the stronghold, posing as the patrol returning from duty.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Should Alphinaud and I prove less distracting than hoped, I will contact you via linkpearl. Be ready to beat a hasty retreat.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Wedge will lead the way in the reaper. Stay close to him.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And I hardly need tell you this, but don't do anything suspicious!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Oh, and lest you wonder, Yda and Y'shtola left shortly before you arrived. We had planned that they should linger in the vicinity, to cover our retreat in the event that Alphinaud and I attracted too much attention─but the approach of an imperial vehicle forced us to improvise.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Don't be too disappointed─they did at least leave a message for you. Something along the lines of “don't do anything reckless,” if memory serves. Wise words.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: All right, the imperial patrol should be returning any moment now. You'd best be off.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Good luck, Forename! May the Twelve keep you!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: You have spirit, that I will allow. Yet you struggle to the benefit of none, least of all yourself.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ugh!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: This “Echo” of yours intrigues us. We desire only to understand it. And for that, we need your help.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: You wish to be rid of the eikons, do you not?

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: You would have saved yourself a great deal of torment had you accepted our aid from the beginning.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ugh! Ugggh...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Tell me everything, and I shall end it quickly. Refuse, and though you beg for death, you shall not have it.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Which will it be?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ugggh! Ugh...

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: As you wish, my dear Minfilia.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Unpleasant though it will be for all concerned, you leave us no choice but to employ more rigorous methods of study.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Be so kind as to deliver the prisoners to Castrum Meridianum.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Yes, milady!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: <whimper> <moan>

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Part of the maintenance crew from Occidens, are you? I don't know what they teach you over there, but being an engineer does not exempt you from saluting your superiors!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Why aren't you in uniform!? Dressed as you are, you're like to be mistaken for an adventurer!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Part of the maintenance crew from Occidens, you say? I don't know what they teach you over there, but being an engineer does not exempt you from saluting your superiors!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Hm, that's a fine salute. Part of the maintenance crew from Occidens, are you? Welcome to Castrum Centri, engineer.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Hm, that's a fine salute...but why aren't you in uniform? As you are, you're like to be mistaken for an adventurer!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What? Prisoners? Ah, you've heard the rumors, then. Yes, they're being held in the storage tower─but I strongly suggest you pay them no mind.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: You were summoned here to work, not to gawp at Eorzea's defeated heroes. Now show a bit of enthusiasm, or I'll have you reported.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What was that supposed to be? A salute? I'll have you know, being an engineer does not give you license to be sloppy! Do it till you get it right!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Huh? Doesn't your senior officer have anything to say about your outfit? Not that I'm complaining, by the way─I for one would appreciate a bit more variety. I'm so used to seeing this uniform, I've caught myself saluting reflective surfaces.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: I'd best get back to my duties. The supplies aren't going to move themselves─and neither are the prisoners, come to that.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Oh, my apologies! I didn't notice you there, so engrossed was I in my task. You'd be engrossed, too, had the tribunus commanded you to arrange for the prisoners to be transported.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Ah, your spirited salute reminds me that, uniform or no, we are all proud soldiers of the Garlean Empire. Everything we do is for the greater glory of Garlemald, be it scrubbing the privy floor or arranging for prisoners to be transported.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What prisoners do I speak of? ...You mean you haven't heard? Only the infamous “Scions of the Seventh Dawn,” captured by the tribunus herself! If you don't believe me, have a look in the storage tower when next you pass that way.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: The officers constantly tell me that I have the sloppiest salute in all the western lands, but in you I'd say I've finally met my match. Perhaps we could practice together?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Whoa... Where did you leave your uniform!? If one of the brass hats sees you, you'll be in for the dressing-down of your life!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Hm? Shouldn't I be at my post? <sigh> I suppose so, but such things don't seem to matter anymore. I've...I've fallen for one of the prisoners. She's all I can think about of late. Am I...am I a deviant for wanting her to salute me?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Greetings, comrade. Forgive me for asking, but you haven't visited the storage tower recently, have you? I only ask because I dropped something in there, and...um... Oh, who am I fooling!? I've fallen for one of the prisoners, all right!? I daresay you know the one I mean. ...Eh? The svelte blonde? Goodness, no!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text:
It's the Lalafellin lass I'm smitten with! She's so adorable, it hurts! I want to sweep her up into my arms and squeeze her till my arms ache!
What do you reckon it would take to convince the centurion to lend me the key so I can see her?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: No, no, no! You're doing it all wrong! Unless you can master a good old-fashioned imperial salute, you'll never amount to anything in this army. Take the centurion, for example: his every salute's the same. It's no wonder he's been entrusted with such responsibility. Which is probably why he's been trusted with the keys to the storage tower.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Why are you not at your post? If you have business, salute me before opening your mouth.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Unless you can explain why you are not in uniform, and during a period of heightened security, to boot, you have earned yourself time in a black cell.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What's this? You need access to the storage tower? What business have you there?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What's this? You need access to the storage tower? What business have you there?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: ...At the tribunus's behest, you say? This is highly irregular, but it would not do to make my lady wroth. Take my identification key. See that it is returned when your errand is concluded.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What mummery is this? You have just earned yourself a fortnight in a black cell. Report to detention at the end of your shift.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Security's tight, just as we expected. We're going to need a special key if we want to get past this bulkhead.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Minfilia...and the rest! Thank goodness they're safe!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I am the one you want! Leave the others be!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: If you harm my friends, I swear I shall take my own life─and you shall answer to your mistress!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: <gasp> T-Tataru! We must do something!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: We risk letting the entire castrum know we're here.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Aye...you're right. We may not get a better chance.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: This is the third squadron. What is it?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: ...A reaper? Seized when?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: ...And this came to light only NOW!?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: The culprits will have left a trail. Take as many men as you need and scour the area! I want that reaper found!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Now's our chance!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: What the─!? Strike my last!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: Eliminate the intruders!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: <whimper> Forename! I was so scared!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It was foolish of you to come here. You might have been killed!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But...thank you. I shudder to think what might have happened had you not arrived when you did.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: I say, did you not see Thancred anywhere? I'm beginning to fear for the fellow...

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: To linger here shall yield us no answer. Let us away, ere the window to our liberty closes shut.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: ...What did you say? Escaped?

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Then recapture them! Fail and I shall have your head.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: ...And what have we here?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...The tribunus herself, just as you said. You have the eye of an ahriman, Yda.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Well...she's kind of hard to miss in that showy armor of hers.

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Accursed Scions... How did you slip our defenses?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: With unexpected ease, if truth be told. There chanced to be a commotion outside the castrum's walls which allowed us to avail ourselves of the comforts of your vehicle.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Y'shtola's just being polite. That was one of the most uncomfortable things I've ever stowed away in. It's no wonder it's called the Phantom Train─no passenger would be seen dead on it!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: So you scuttled in amidst the freight, like the vermin you are. I shall be sure to have words with our ratcatcher. Such negligence is unforgivable.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: That is far from your most pressing concern. First, you must answer for your own wrongdoing, Livia sas Junius.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: 'Twas you who led the raid on the Waking Sands─you who butchered unarmed men and women for the crime of being unworthy of capture.

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: You killed our friends! We'll never forgive you!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Nor shall we suffer you to plague Eorzea a day longer. Betake you to your guard.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: More intruders! Protect the tribunus!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Confound it! Yda, with me!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: After them!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Where is His Excellency?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: In the hangar, my lady─in discussion with our guest!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: Alert him at once!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: Yes, my lady!

dialogue.name: LIVIA
dialogue.text: No! No, no, NO!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: There they are! Fan out and surround them!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Must...protect...Tataru! Biggs─I'm going in! See everyone to safety!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: No! Wedge─don't do it!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Oh, no... Forename─hold them off! I'll look after Minfilia and Tataru!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Take the leader! Kill the rest!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: What the─!?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Y'shtola!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Pray forgive us our delay!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Papalymo! Minfilia!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Yda!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: What took you so long!?

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Well, it's nice to see you too!

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The reunion must wait!

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Right! First things first!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Yes, let's get back to being heavily outnumbered...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: You ditched your magitek armor!? Fool of a Lalafell!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Well, excuse me! She's all yours if you think you can do any better!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: <gasp>

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: But there's no one in there!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: This is Cid! Can you hear me!?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I need you to count to five, then jump! Understood!?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: One...

dialogue.name: YDA
dialogue.text: Two!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Three!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Four!

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: I know not which is more pitiful: the charlatans who rule Eorzea...

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: ...or the masses that clamor for their implausible panaceas.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: I see that which they cannot. This realm founders for want of a ruler with true power─the power to cast down eikons.

dialogue.name: GAIUS
dialogue.text: If you continue to deny this truth, it is the people who will suffer. Embrace reason.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: <gasp>

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells─!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Oh no... It's here!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Twelve preserve us... They finished it. Ultima Weapon...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So it has a name...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: It is a relic of ancient Allag, excavated from its resting place deep beneath Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Allagans used it to crush primal and foe alike...and now the Garleans mean to do the same!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Damn you, Gaius!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Look! There, beside the Black Wolf!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An Ascian!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An overlord, no less. His garb attests to that.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Lahabrea! It could only be him!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: He was Lahabrea...? No... No, this cannot be!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We have to go now! Hang on!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred! NOOOOOO!

dialogue.name: LAHABREAEORZEA
dialogue.text: Ahahaha... Muahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: All that time, the enemy was beside me, and I never even suspected.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And to think that it was I who suggested that Thancred investigate the Ascians! How could I have been so blind!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Small wonder the enemy knew our every move─and where to find us! Confound it all!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No... No, this is not the time for self-doubt. The Alliance leaders staked their hopes on the Scions, but now they believe us all dead or missing.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: When they learn of the Empire's new weapon, we cannot be certain what they will do.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We must go and offer them what assurances we can that defeat is not inevitable!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text:
Krile? This is Minfilia. I am in some haste, so forgive me if I seem brusque. The item I requested─is it ready? Wonderful! I am sorry to press, but we need it urgently. How soon can it be delivered?
...I am in your debt, my friend.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The situation may have taken an ill turn...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But the battle is far from over. And so long as we stand together, there shall ever be hope of victory.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The people of Eorzea falter for want of such hope. Let us provide it. Let us bear to them the tidings that the Scions of the Seventh Dawn are returned!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Matters are coming to a head. I hope we can count on you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: ...My regards to Grandfather.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I am ready. Let us pay a visit to the council of the Alliance leadership.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hells take the Black Wolf and his new toy...

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Rally all available forces. I want them ready to move upon my word.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And relay to Slafyrsyn the order to sail. That is all.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom stands ready. What of the Flames?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ready as we're like to be. I need only give the word to Roaille.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Has there been no word from Ishgard?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: None. The dragons have got their tongues.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Silent to the last. I was unwise to hope for better.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: What would stir the archbishop to open his holy mouth, if not this!? And he claims the Fury for his god... 'Tis bad comedy!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: The Holy See has made its choice. We will proceed without its cooperation.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I believe we are all acquainted with the terms of the Black Wolf's ultimatum.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: We must agree upon a course of action. Naught less than the fate of Eorzea hangs upon the decision of this council.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Van Baelsar claims to wield the power to smite primals.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Should we yield to him, he pledges to rid the realm of its false gods. Yet offer resistance, and he swears that we shall share the primals' fate.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Pardon me my bluntness, but I like not these choices.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: This is too great a decision for any one of our nations to make alone.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Choose we surrender or resistance, we must answer as one, for if but one surrenders, the rest shall surely fall. Let us pray for the wisdom to do right by all our peoples.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Thancred's plight troubles us all, yet we cannot allow anything to come between us and our goal.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: So long as the Ultima Weapon exists, Eorzea will never know peace.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Let us go to the Alliance leaders, Forename, and help them to make the right decision.

dialogue.name: ELYENORA
dialogue.text: Greetings, madamsir. Do you wish to proceed to your vessel?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Proceed to the landing area?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Unbind Papalymo and Urianger!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the enemy and rescue the Scions!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the enemy and escape from Castrum Centri!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You came!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Unbind us, Forename. Together we may yet win free.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Forename! Get these shackles off us, quickly!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: Take them, whatever the cost!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALSOLDIER
dialogue.text: All units, to emergency stations! Do not let the prisoners escape!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: This infernal creation is shielded by energies not its own.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Whatever is generating its shield must be near! Find it, Forename!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Ack! There's no end to them!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We labor in vain! Till the beast be divested of its shield, our blows shall not find their mark.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALGUARD
dialogue.text: You're not getting away! Bring forth the colossus!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: What in the hells...? A new design!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Have care!

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Ware the unknown foe.

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: So that's a colossus, is it!? More like a colossal waste of iron!

dialogue.name: PAPALYMO
dialogue.text: Ungh... Confound it...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Mine eyes...darken...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Tataru... Forgive me...

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: I...I couldn't... Ungh...

obj.n: Every Little Thing She Does Is Magitek
